page.title: 11Factories_Food Processing.
page.content: Moores Bakery opens directly onto the main A.35 road. This family Buisness Started to flourish at the turn of the 19th. Century, son succeeding father in the management of the enterprise. The famous 'Dorset Knobs' and also 'Choolate Chip' biscuits and 'Walnut Crunch' are famous throughout the southern counties. All processing and baking are carried out on the premises and the public are invited to watch the men and women at work at all stages of the manufacture. Ten or twelve people are fully employed, sometimes extra hands are needed when supplies are being made ready for the Christmas trade. An attractive retailing section displays biscuits and Home_Made preserves and visitors may also see a pictoral history of the firm displayed
